item.title: To Feel at Home in a New Place, It Helps to Think Like a Snail
item.description: When I moved abroad, I found the slimy mollusks everywhere. Then they taught me how to adapt.

item.title: A Rupture Over Israel Is Tearing MAGA Apart
item.description: For 40 years, Christian Zionism was a powerful force in American politics. A new generation on the right is taking cues from elsewhere.

item.title: There’s Something Missing in Films About Jewish Cultural Figures
item.description: Why do films relating to Neil Diamond, Bob Dylan and Robert Oppenheimer barely mention their Jewishness?

item.title: Should You Tell a Stranger That She Has Bird Poop on Her Shoulder?
item.description: A ruling on a matter of coffee-shop etiquette.

item.title: Someone Made Anonymous Accusations About My Friend. What Should I Do?
item.description: Normally I would listen to my gut, but even my gut is stumped.

item.title: The Revealing (and Alarming) Exercise of Cyberstalking Your Own Home
item.description: Easily accessible archives can turn up stories both humorous and hair-raising, and they all connect us to something bigger.

item.title: Could Viral Protest Videos Create a Backlash Against ‘Less Lethal’ Weapons?
item.description: They were developed during the civil rights movement to reduce harm, but their rampant use during anti-ICE protests has led to a new kind of violence.

item.title: Do I Have to Tell My New Boyfriend About My Past Infidelity?
item.description: He knows I started seeing someone as my marriage was deteriorating, but I have not admitted the full truth.

item.title: Is It a Good Idea to Wrap Your Christmas Tree?
item.description: A belated ruling on the limits of holiday magic.

item.title: How the MAGA Plan to Control TV Triggered a Free-Speech Fight
item.description: Under Trump, the F.C.C. has used obscure regulatory powers to crack down on network TV. Some conservatives are pushing back.

item.title: George Saunders Says Ditching These Three Delusions Can Save You
item.description: The celebrated author on the challenges of being kind, the benefits of meditation and the reality check of death.

item.title: Why on Earth Have I Seen the Same Broadway Show 13 Times? An Investigation.
item.description: As a journalist, I thought I’d never join the ranks of obsessive superfans — until I suddenly became one.

item.title: We Asked 10 of the Year’s Best Actors How They Conjure Feelings on Cue
item.description: Teyana Taylor, Liam Neeson, Rose Byrne and more of our best actors on how they summon the emotions that move us.

item.title: This Year’s Film Performances Were So Good, We Had To Invent New Awards
item.description: Best Acting in a Helmet, Best Nervous Breakdown, Craziest Charm—the film performances so good Wesley Morris had to invent his own categories.
